Article Title: Telugu media mogul Ramoji Rao passes away
Article Text: The man who straddled the media and film industry in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana for half a century, Cherukuri Ramoji Rao , passed away at the age of 87 in the city. Ramoji Rao, who had been ailing for some time, was admitted to a hospital on Friday and put on ventilator support . He passed away on Saturday.Prime Minister elect Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu have condoled his death. His last rites will be performed with state honours at Ramoji Film City on Sunday.A recipient of the Padma Vibhushan, Ramoji Rao put Hyderabad on the world map by launching Ramoji Film City, which was dubbed as a one-stop shop for movie making. Launched in 1996, it is the world's largest film studio. Bollywood shot films here and some international movies were also made on its sprawling grounds.Ramoji Rao hailed from Pedaparupudu village in Krishna district of Andhra Pradesh. Always dressed in white, he was known to be meticulous at work building his business empire, including a chit fund company, and a pickle brand among others. It was Ramoji Rao who brought Tollywood super star N T Rama Rao into politics."He was a visionary who revolutionized Indian media. His rich contributions have left an indelible mark on journalism and the world of films. Ramoji Rao Garu was extremely passionate about India's development. I am fortunate to have got several opportunities to interact with him and benefit from his wisdom," Modi said on X.TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu also paid his last respects on Saturday. Telangana chief minister A Revanth Reddy, former Andhra Pradesh chief minister Y S Jangamohan Reddy, and a host of political leaders and film personalities have condoled his passing away.Filmmaker S S Rajamouli said on social media: "One man with his 50 years of resilience, hard work and innovation provided employment, livelihood and hope for millions. The only way we can pay tribute to Ramoji Rao garu is conferring him with 'Bharat Ratna'. As a mark of respect to Ramoji Rao, the Telugu film industry has cancelled shootings on Sunday."BJP leader G Kishan Reddy has been deputed by Modi to officially represent the central government at the last rites of Ramoji Rao.
Article Summary: Ramoji Rao straddled the media and film industry in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana for half a century. Prime Minister elect Narendra Modi and President Droupadi Murmu have condoled his death. His last rites will be performed with state honours at Ramoji Film City on Sunday.

Article Title: Sub-Lt Anamika Rajeev is Navy’s first woman helicopter pilot
Article Text: NEW DELHI: After IAF and Army, Indian Navy has also begun inducting women as helicopter pilots , with sub-lieutenant Anamika B Rajeev becoming the first to get the “golden wings” at the passing-out parade at naval air station INS Rajali in Tamil Nadu’s Arakkonam.In another milestone, Lieutenant Jamyang Tsewang, the first officer from Ladakh to be commissioned into the Navy, also successfully graduated as a qualified helicopter pilot.The two were among the 21 pilots of the 102nd helicopter conversion course to be awarded the “golden wings” by Eastern Naval Command chief vice admiral Rajesh Pendharkar at the parade on Friday.The naval pilots underwent the 22-week training programme at INS Rajali after initial training with IAF. While the Navy already has women pilots flying the Dornier-228 maritime patrol aircraft, Sub-Lt Rajeev is the first to gain entry into the force’s helicopter fleet that includes Chetaks, Sea Kings, Dhruvs and the spanking new submarine-hunting MH-60R Seahawk helicopters, which are armed with Hellfire missiles, MK-54 torpedoes and precision-kill rockets.There are already 19 women flying fighters like MiG-21s, MiG-29s, Sukhoi-30MKIs and even the new omni-role Rafales in the IAF, while there are over 145 women helicopter and transport aircraft pilots in the IAF, Army and the Navy.While women are still not allowed to join the infantry, armoured corps and mechanised infantry, women officers are now also being commissioned in the Regiment of Artillery.
Article Summary: After IAF and Army, Indian Navy has also begun inducting women as helicopter pilots. Sub-lieutenant Anamika B Rajeev is the first to get the ‘golden wings’ at the passing-out parade at naval air station INS Rajali in Tamil Nadu’s Arakkonam.

Article Title: ‘2 Sena (UBT) MPs contacted CM, said they’ll rope in 4 more to back Modi’, claims Shiv Sena MP Naresh Mhaske
Article Text: MUMBAI: Newly elected Shiv Sena MP Naresh Mhaske claimed on Saturday that two Shiv Sena (UBT) MPs had made contact with chief minister Eknath Shinde-led Sena and wanted to support Prime Minister Narendra Modi to get development works in their constituencies.Mhaske claimed the two MPs are worried about disqualification, so they said they would get six MPs together and then back PM Modi with CM Shinde .In the Lok Sabha polls, the Shinde-led Sena won seven seats and the Sena (UBT) nine. Mhaske claimed if six of the nine MPs left the Sena (UBT), they would not be disqualified. Mhaske said that soon "operation bow and arrow" will be successful.Dismissing Mhaske's claims, Sena (UBT) functionary Sushma Andhare said, "Naresh Mhaske is doing this to get attention. This immature statement is just a way to show his own loyalty. But such people are not taken seriously. He's an MP now, so he should not make such a statement. If he has the names, then he must declare them. This is only to seek some attention and try and get himself a ministerial position in the Centre."Sena (UBT) MLC Sachin Ahir too described Mhaske's claims as immature and said there was no way that Sena (UBT) MPs who are all loyalists and had fought the Shinde Sena and BJP would even think of joining Shinde."Two MPs are in contact with us. They are from the Sena (UBT) and they are not happy with the way the Sena (UBT) asked for votes. They thought the INDIA bloc would form govt. But that hasn't happened. They want development works in the constituency and they want to support PM Modi. So they have made contact. They will get four more MPs and then support the Shinde Sena once they are six MPs so that they don't get disqualified," Mhaske said.Before the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, the united Shiv Sena had 18 MPs. Of them, 13 joined the Shinde-led faction and five remained with Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray. In all, the Shinde-led Sena had dropped five sitting MPs from its 13 in the state. Tumane from Ramtek, Hemant Patil from Hingoli and Bhavana Gawali from Yavatmal Washim were dropped. The party also dropped sitting MP Gajanan Kirtikar from Mumbai North-West. It had to drop Rajendra Gavit since BJP took the Palghar seat and gave the ticket to Dr Hemant Savara.
Article Summary: Shiv Sena MP Naresh Mhaske claims two Shiv Sena (UBT) MPs have made contact with chief minister Eknath Shinde-led Sena. Sena functionary Sushma Andhare said, "This immature statement is just a way to show his own loyalty"

Article Title: Review guarantees as people voted BJP: Congress spokesperson to Karnataka CM
Article Text: MYSURU: M Lakshmana, the state Congress spokesperson who lost the Lok Sabha elections from Mysuru, has called upon CM Siddaramaiah to reassess and reevaluate the guarantee schemes being run by the government in Karnataka.Addressing reporters here on Saturday, Lakshmana pointed out that BJP has accused the state govt of encouraging laziness through these guarantee schemes, while the voters have supported the BJP, indicating a lack of interest in these freebies. He suggested the state govt should make these schemes available only for the needy.While insisting that he was not disheartened or disappointed by his defeat, Lakshmana questioned the voters of Mysuru, wondering for how long will they continue to disappoint and humiliate the CM, who has undertaken significant development work in Mysuru. He claimed the previous CM, Basavaraj Bommai, did not allocate even Rs 5 worth of development projects for Mysuru."People can defeat me any number of times, but I don't know why they are doing such injustice to CM Siddaramaiah. Why are they hurting him? There is no CM with such a clean image in the entire country," he further claimed. Lakshmana also wondered what more did he need to do to prove his Vokkaliga credentials.
Article Summary: M Lakshmana, the state Congress spokesperson who lost the Lok Sabha elections from Mysuru, has called upon CM Siddaramaiah to reassess and reevaluate the guarantee schemes being run by the government in Karnataka. He suggested the state govt should make these schemes available only for the needy.

Article Title: Cops quiz man on sample swap money trail
Article Text:
Cops are questioning Ashpaque Makandar , a liaison person, to find the source of Rs 3 lakh he handed to a grade-IV staffer of Sassoon Hospital to swap the blood sample of the minor involved in the May 19 crash. Police said Makandar functioned as a middleman between the minor’s father and hospital staff. He and his associate Amar Santosh Gaikwad (27) were arrested Tuesday.

A crime branch officer said, “Earlier we thought the cash was given to grade-IV staffer Atul Ghatkamble on the hospital premises. Now, it has been revealed that the cash was delivered to him at the Govt Observation Home for Boys in Yerawada on May 19.”
Article Summary: Ashpaque Makandar functioned as a middleman between the minor’s father and hospital staff. He and his associate Amar Santosh Gaikwad (27) were arrested Tuesday. A crime branch officer said, “Earlier we thought the cash was given to grade-IV staffer Atul Ghatkamble on the hospital premises”

Article Title: Opposition parties to take call on attending Modi oath-taking ceremony
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Congress and the opposition parties were mulling if to attend the oath-taking ceremony of Narendra Modi on Sunday. Sources said Congress president received the invite late night for the event, which will be attended by leaders of South Asia and Indian Ocean Region.Earlier, AICC managers Jairam Ramesh and KC Venugopal chided BJP that Indian leaders have not received the invite yet, while all the invitations were going to international leaders. They said the INDIA parties will take a decision, when they get the invitation.Sources said discussions were held between the opposition parties on Saturday, and the view was that they could stay away. But a final decision will be taken tomorrow.Jairam Ramesh said, "The person taking the oath has lost his personal, political and moral authority. Mandate was sought in Modi's name, he did not get it. This is one-third PM. We don't understand why this drama of swearing-in is being undertaken."
Article Summary: Congress and opposition parties mulling if to attend the oath-taking ceremony of Narendra Modi on Sunday. AICC managers Jairam Ramesh and KC Venugopal chided BJP that Indian leaders have not received the invite yet.

Article Title: Lok Sabha elections: CWC praises Kharge, Gandhis for poll efforts
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The Congress Working Committee ( CWC ), in a resolution, praised the efforts of party chief Mallikarjun Kharge , Rahul Gandhi, Sonia Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra in the just concluded Parliamentary elections .Meanwhile, asked if Rahul will retain Rae Bareli or Amethi , AICC general secretary K C Venugopal said the decision will be announced within four days.Talking about Kharge, the resolution noted, "The sheer energy and determination of Kharge was an inspiration to everyone. He was bold and fearless both in Parliament and outside." Rahul is said to have specially praised octogenarian Kharge's tireless campaign.Kharge lauded Rahul's Yatras, noting that the party's votes and seats had increased on their route, naming Meghalaya, Manipur, Assam, Nagaland and Maharashtra. He said Rahul converted the Constitution, unemployment, inflation, economic inequality, social justice and harmony into "people's issues", adding that "panch nyay" manifesto emerged from his interactions with common people during his yatras. The resolution said, "More than any other individual, it was Rahul who made the protection of our Republic's Constitution the central issue in the 2024 elections."Calling "Priyanka's campaign as nothing short of being brilliant", the CWC said she exposed the BJP relentlessly and communicated the Congress's key messages powerfully.
Article Summary: Kharge lauded Rahul's Yatras, noting that the party's votes and seats had increased on their route. AICC general secretary K C Venugopal said the decision will be announced within four days. Rahul is said to have specially praised octogenarian Kharge's tireless campaign.

Article Title: CWC urges Rahul Gandhi to take over as leader of opposition; will consider, says MP
Article Text: NEW DELHI: With the party claiming that people have put it "firmly on the path of revival", the Congress Working Committee led by president Mallikarjun Kharge Saturday demanded in one voice that Rahul Gandhi take over as the leader of opposition (LOP) in Lok Sabha to carry forward the fight for welfare and democracy inside the Parliament.The CWC also passed a resolution urging Rahul-as-LOP , while the Gandhi scion replied he will think over the demand.Later, AICC general secretary K C Venugopal said, "Rahul Gandhi is the best person to lead us in the Parliament. For a strong and vigilant opposition, those who want to protect the Constitution also... should be safe under the leadership of Rahul as LOP."Also, Sonia Gandhi was re-elected as the chairperson of the Congress Parliamentary Party by Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MPs, who would now nominate the leaders in the two Houses. While Kharge is set to stay on as the LOP in the Upper House, the possibility of Rahul taking up the top responsibility in the LS is open.As an upbeat Congress wrapped up the inhouse formalities in the wake of electoral performance that saw its tally nearly double from 2019, Sonia Gandhi said Modi is unlikely to change the substance and style of his governance, warning of "challenging times ahead"."We have to be alert to prevent any attempts to increase polarisation and erosion of secular and democratic values by the ruling cabal. All such attempts must be thwarted," Sonia Gandhi said.Kharge said people voted to "save democracy and the Constitution" and the mandate is a rejection of BJP's ten years of politics of hate and polarisation. In a resolution, the CWC thanked the people for "voting so powerfully to preserve our democracy, protect the Republic's Constitution and enhance social and economic justice." It criticised the PM for running a campaign anchored in bigotry.Sonia said "a mighty and malevolent machine" tried to destroy Congress by crippling it financially and through a campaign of lies against the party leaders. "Many wrote our obituaries. But under the determined leadership of Kharge, we persevered," she said. The CWC noted, "The people have given Congress another chance. It is now up to us to build on it."Taking jibes at Modi, Sonia said the PM sidelined the BJP and its allies to seek a mandate "solely in his name", but has suffered a political and moral defeat. "In reality, he has lost the mandate and the right to leadership as well. Yet, far from taking responsibility for failure, he intends to get himself sworn in again tomorrow," she mocked.The possibility of Rahul taking over the LOP post increased in view of the CWC resolution.At the meeting, veteran Digvijaya Singh raised the demand for Rahul taking over the LOP, which was echoed by Gaurav Gogoi, Devendra Yadav, CMs Siddaramaiah, Revanth Reddy, among others. They said his leadership will boost the voice of the party members. Interestingly, according to sources, Kharge underlined that over 200 MPs will be standing behind him when he takes on the government.The perch will place Rahul at the head of the opposition bloc which has returned to the 18th Lok Sabha with a boosted tally after a decade, and the coming together of the anti-BJP parties under the INDIA bloc is likely to boost cohesion too.Kharge said Congress has posted a good performance, and increased its seats in SC/ST/OBC/minority dominated areas and in rural regions, but the party has to win in urban areas too. He pointedly noted that Congress has underperformed in the states where it had won assembly elections, in a reference to Karnataka, Himachal and Telangana.Thanking the INDIA allies for fighting well in different states, the CWC singled out Uttar Pradesh, West Bengal, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra for special mention.At the same time, Kharge told party members that elections will be held in important states in coming months, a reference to Haryana and Maharashtra, and the party should defeat the rivals at any cost. "People want a change, and we have to become their strength," he said.Congress members lamented the absence of a level playing field in the elections, or else the BJP would have got 100-150 seats fewer. Gogoi said the Modi govt will not complete its term.
Article Summary: Congress Working Committee led by Mallikarjun Kharge demands Rahul Gandhi take over as leader of opposition (LOP) in Lok Sabha. Sonia Gandhi re-elected as the chairperson of the Congress Parliamentary Party by Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha MPs, who would now nominate the leaders in the two Houses.

Article Title: Vande Bharat loco pilot gets invite to Modi's swearing-in
Article Text: NAGPUR: When assistant loco pilot Sneh Singh Baghel met Prime Minister-designate Narendra Modi briefly during the flagging of the semi-high-speed Vande Bharat at Nagpur railway station in Dec 2022, he could hardly have imagined that he would be one of the 10 loco pilots receiving an invite to his swearing-in ceremony.“It’s such a great honour. I couldn’t believe my ears when I got the phone call,” Baghel told TOI.With 3 years of experience, Baghel is a trained rail worker under Mission Karmayogi.Besides Baghel, Surekha Yadav LP from Central Railway, Preeti Sahu from WCR, Srini Shrivastava from NER, Aishwarya Menon from Southern Railway, ASP Tirkey from SER, N Prakash from SCR, Lalith Kumar from SWR, Surender Pal Singh from NR, and Satya Raj Mandal from NFR will attend Modi’s oath ceremony.
Article Summary: Sneh Singh Baghel is an assistant loco pilot with 3 years of experience. Baghel met Prime Minister-designate Narendra Modi briefly during the flagging of the semi-high-speed Vande Bharat at Nagpur railway station.

Article Title: 2 cops among 4 government staffers sacked in Jammu and Kashmir for terror links

TOI

SRINAGAR/ NEW DELHI: J&K administration on Saturday sacked its four employees — two police constables, a school teacher and an assistant lineman — over alleged terror links and activities that include supply of ammunition to terrorists and servicing of their weapons, playing guide to infiltrating terrorists and mobilising violent protests to keep Kashmir on the boil.Invoking Article 311(2) (c) of the Constitution, J&K LG Manoj Sinha ordered the dismissals after “a discreet background check by J&K CID established that the four staffers — constables Abdul Rehman Dar and Ghulam Rasool Bhat, school teacher Shabeer Ahmad Wani and assistant lineman Anayatullah Shah Pirzada — were acting on behalf of Pakistan’s ISI and terror outfits sponsored by it”.With these four terminations, 61 J&K government staffers have faced termination under Article 311(2) (c) during Sinha’s tenure in J&K.As per CID dossiers accessed by, Abdul Rehman Dar hails from Tral.Recruited in 2002, Dar was mostly seen with overground workers, including Sajjad Hussain Parray, with whom he ran a garments business. Article Title: Modi to make day-long visit to Italy for G7 on June 14
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Days after his swearing-in, Narendra Modi will undertake a day-long visit to Italy to participate in the G7 summit on June 14. With Modi unlikely to attend the Ukraine peace summit, which will be hosted by Switzerland immediately after G7, he's expected to be back the next day, in time for the Parliament session beginning mid-June.Unlike China, India is likely to participate in the Switzerland summit, for which Russia has not been invited, but at a junior level. Modi will address the G7 outreach session on June 14 and have bilateral meetings with several G7 leaders, as also with counterparts from other invitee countries. Govt sources said efforts were on to schedule as many bilateral meetings as possible on the margins of the summit.Modi is expected to address issues related to development, health and food security, while ducking G7 recriminations against Russia. The G7 is expected to announce at the summit progress in their plans to use income from frozen Russian assets for the benefit of Ukraine.Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni, who will host the summit in Apulia, was among the first heads of govt to congratulate Modi for the majority his NDA got in the Lok Sabha elections.In a post on X, Meloni said she was sure "that we will continue to work together to strengthen the friendship that unites Italy and India and consolidate cooperation on the various issues that bind us, for the well-being of our nations and our peoples".Modi responded by thanking Meloni and saying he remained committed to deepening the India-Italy strategic partnership which is underpinned by shared values and interests.
Article Summary: Modi is expected to address issues related to development, health and food security, while ducking G7 recriminations against Russia. Modi will address the G7 outreach session on June 14 and have bilateral meetings with several G7 leaders. Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni was among the first heads of govt to congratulate Modi for the majority his NDA got in the Lok Sabha elections.

Article Title: Challenges ahead for BJP-led NDA government with secular allies
Article Text: NEW DELHI: The new BJP-led NDA government , dependent on its allies , since on its own the saffron party is short of 32 votes from the simple majority mark of 272 in a House of 543 Lok Sabha seats, will find it difficult to push for BJP’s hard Hindutva line, since its main support comes from secular parties like TDP and JD(U).Among the NDA partners, substantial support to BJP which finished with 240 seats, comes from N Chandrababu Naidu ’s TDP representing Andhra Pradesh and Nitish Kumar ’s JDU representing Bihar.With that equation holding the Narendra Modi-led government, it will be difficult for BJP to push its hard Hindutva line, since Naidu and Kumar have both to cater to its minority voters in their respective states. Both seasoned, veteran leaders have been known for wooing minority voters and hence would have to take care to see minority citizens are not offended.Even before the swearing-in, TDP general secretary and Naidu’s son Nara Lokesh on Friday made a public statement saying his party is committed to the current 4% reservation for Muslims under the OBC list, as it is meant to expose the under-represented to opportunities.Naturally the previous Modi government’s policies of bringing CAA and NRC or approving UCC in some states and other such RSS-driven policies that hurts interests of minorities, are bound to hit a roadblock for now, if the government has to function.Even BJP’s hard Hindutva party line will have to be blurred, to create a comfort zone for the allies, who have become crucial for the survival of Modi’s third term at office.Kumar has been pushing for a national caste census, that RSS-BJP are uncomfortable with, hence it is to be seen whether it becomes a sticky point in the new coalition or the Modi government agrees to it.The minority population in Andhra Pradesh is 36.63 lakh (excluding Christians) as per the 2011 census of which Muslims 36.17 lakhs, Sikhs 0.10 lakhs, Buddhists 0.04 lakhs, Jains 0.27 lakhs and Parsis 0.04 lakhs. That Naidu will also head the state government in Andhra Pradesh, makes it more significant for him to be able to address the issues of the minorities.Bihar is home to almost 17% Muslims apart from other minorities and hence Kumar’s JD(U) has traditionally opposed anti-minorityism. In fact, for a long time before Kumar accepted working with Modi, even as there has been many flip-flops since, it was Modi’s anti-minority image during his chief ministership days in Gujarat, that created a political divide between the two leaders.While it is a matter of the past, it would not be easy for Kumar to accept hard-Hindutva agenda that was the mark of the last terms of Modi’s majority government.
Article Summary: N Chandrababu Naidu ’s TDP representing Andhra Pradesh and Nitish Kumar’s JDU representing Bihar. Both seasoned, veteran leaders have been known for wooing minority voters. TDP general secretary Nara Lokesh said his party is committed to the current 4% reservation for Muslims under the OBC list.

Article Title: Hired cook dies in alleged BSF shooting on J&K border
Article Text: JAMMU: A 28-year-old cook hired for a construction project near an outpost along the India-Pakistan border in Samba district of J&K was fatally shot in the chest allegedly by BSF guards late Friday evening, police said Saturday, suggesting it may be a case of mistaken identity.The cook — Vasudev from Akhnoor in Jammu district — allegedly wandered from the construction site to the border in the darkness. “As BSF guards from the outpost noticed suspicious movement, they sounded a warning. They asked the man to halt and identify himself. Instead of stopping, he allegedly began running, prompting the guards to shoot,” Samba ASP Surinder Choudhary said.Vasudev was taken to a hospital in Samba, where he was declared dead upon arrival. Choudhary said police have “taken cognizance of the case and further investigation is ongoing”. BSF hasn’t issued any statement till late Saturday.Samba ADC Suresh Kumar Sharma said an ex gratia of Rs 5 lakh, including Rs 4 lakh from the construction company, has been given to the family, who received the body after the autopsy.Initially, the shooting was suspected to be a ceasefire violation by Pakistani troops. Though such cases have decreased since Feb 2021, when the two neighbours agreed to strictly adhere to the 2003 ceasefire agreement, occasional violations by Pakistani Rangers have occurred.On November 9 last year, a BSF trooper suffered fatal wounds due to unprovoked firing from the Pakistani side. Earlier cases of firing and shelling on October 17 and 28 resulted in four BSF troopers and a woman being wounded.
Article Summary: A 28-year-old cook hired for a construction project near an outpost in Samba district of J&K was fatally shot in the chest allegedly by BSF guards. The cook — Vasudev from Akhnoor in Jammu district — allegedly wandered from the construction site to the border in the darkness. BSF hasn’t issued any statement till late Saturday.

Article Title: Status quo on demolition order for bungalow of J&K ex-deputy CM Nirmal Singh’s wife
Article Text: JAMMU: J&K and Ladakh high court has ordered status quo in a special tribunal’s directive to demolish the house of Mamta Singh, wife of Nirmal Singh , former J&K deputy chief minister. The status quo is subject to objections and till the next date of hearing.Justice Vinod Chatterji Koul passed the order in response to a petition filed by Mamta challenging the J&K Special Tribunal order about upholding the demolition order by the Jammu Development Authority . In her petition, Mamta challenged the legality of the special tribunal’s order.On May 20, 2024, the special tribunal had dismissed Mamta’s petition against demolition of her palatial bungalow constructed allegedly in violation of building laws at Ban in Nagrota, a restricted green area as per the Jammu Master Plan, 2032.Asif Hamid Khan, member of the special tribunal, had reprimanded Mamta, passed strictures and imposed a fine of ₹10 lakh for serious misconduct involving criminal contempt of court and perjury for getting favourable orders by taking shelter of falsehood, misrepresentation/suppression of facts and fraud.
Article Summary: J&K and Ladakh high court has ordered status quo in a special tribunal’s directive to demolish the house of Mamta Singh, wife of Nirmal Singh. The status quo is subject to objections and till the next date of hearing.

Article Title: Akhilesh Yadav to be Samajwadi Party's leader in Lok Sabha
Article Text: LUCKNOW: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav will be the party's leader in the Lok Sabha, the formalities for which will be completed in Delhi. Yadav will resign from the Uttar Pradesh Assembly , where he is the Leader of Opposition , a senior party leader said on Saturday.Rajendra Chaudhary, the Samajwadi Party's chief spokesperson, said, "It is understood that Yadav will be the leader of the party in the Lok Sabha but there is a formality of choosing the leader of the parliamentary party and this will be completed in Delhi.""The formality of electing the leader of the parliamentary party will be completed after the swearing-in of the prime minister and the selection of the Lok Sabha's protem speaker," he added.Chaudhary also confirmed that Yadav will resign from the assembly, where he represents the Karhal seat in Mainpuri.The former Uttar Pradesh chief minister has been elected to the Lok Sabha from the Kannauj constituency.As a constituent of the opposition INDIA bloc, the Samajwadi Party won 37 out of Uttar Pradesh's 80 seats to emerge as the third largest party in the Lok Sabha.In a statement, the Samajwadi Party said a meeting of its newly-elected MPs was held at its state headquarters that was chaired by Yadav.He congratulated the MPs for their victory and said, "Our responsibility has increased due to the massive support of the public. The struggle of the socialists to raise the problems of the people, to put forward their views in their interest will continue in the Lok Sabha. The era of positive politics has begun. The issues of the people have won. The struggle of the Samajwadi Party for the interests of the people will continue."He further said, "The results of the Lok Sabha elections have forever made communalism insignificant. The will of the people has won against the will of the BJP. Now we have to prepare for the 2027 assembly elections."The Samajwadi Party chief said social justice is its real agenda. "The fight of the Samajwadi Party is long."
Article Summary: Yadav will resign from the Uttar Pradesh Assembly, where he is the Leader of Opposition. The former Uttar Pradesh chief minister has been elected to the Lok Sabha from the Kannauj constituency. As a constituent of the opposition INDIA bloc, the Samajwadi Party won 37 out of Uttar Pradesh's 80 seats to emerge as the third largest party in Lok Sabha.

Article Title: We will continue to fight for the rights of Punjab: SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal
Article Text: SANGRUR/LUDHIANA: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) president Sukhbir Singh Badal on Saturday started his tour of Punjab to meet his party's workers in all parliamentary constituencies in the state. Of the 13 Lok Sabha seats in Punjab, the party won just one in the recently concluded general elections.While thanking SAD workers for the effort put in by them during the polls, he urged them to be ready to give a strong showing in the forthcoming by-elections.The SAD president visited the residences of party candidates Iqbal Singh Jhunda in Amargarh and Ranjit Singh Dhillon in Ludhiana, and also met party leaders and workers at both places.Asserting that the SAD alone could safeguard the rights of Punjab and Punjabis, Badal said, "We will continue to fight for the rights of Punjab. Be it safeguarding our river waters or demanding our capital city Chandigarh is transferred to us. We will also continue to seek a legal guarantee on MSP for farmers."Urging workers not to get disheartened by the poll result, Badal said, "Now we have to get ready for the forthcoming by-elections.""We must do our best to expose the corruption laden misrule of the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) which has bankrupted the state that has also seen a rise in drug addiction and gangster culture", he said.He said the alliance between the AAP and the Congress had also been exposed in the election with both parties colluding with each other to keep the SAD out of the picture. "People have seen how the Delhi-based parties ganged up against the SAD," Badal added.
Article Summary: Sikhomani Akali Dal (SAD) president Sukhbir Singh Badal on Saturday started his tour of Punjab to meet his party's workers in all parliamentary constituencies. Of the 13 Lok Sabha seats in Punjab, the party won just one in the recently concluded general elections.
